intro: Diplostephium pearcei, commonly known as the pearce's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its succulent, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in a waxy coating, aiding in water retention in arid environments. Diplostephium pearcei is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in full sun and exhibiting drought tolerance.
